docTitle.titlePart:
Electrochemical sensors based on
molecularly imprinted polymers

byline.docAuthor:
M.C. Blanco-Loez, M.J. Lobo-Castanõ, A.J. Miranda-Ordieres,
P. Tunõ-Blanco

front.div:
Molecularly imprinted polymers (MIPs) are becoming an important class
of synthetic materials mimicking molecular recognition by natural
receptors. This review examines the literature on non-covalent MIP-based
electrochemical sensors over the last 10 years. With insight into the
different sensing phases, electrochemical transductions and integration
strategies, we evaluate achievements and difficulties to date and assess
future prospects.
front.keyword: Keywords: Electrochemical sensors; Molecularly imprinted polymers (MIPs)
